text: [Applause]
when Matt Lauer interviewed Hillary
Clinton and Donald Trump in September
2016 he was widely criticized for being
soft on Trump and for hammering Clinton
the word judgment has been used a lot
around You Secretary Clinton over the
last year and a half and in particular
concerning your use of your personal
email you are communicating on highly
sensitive topics why wasn't it more than
a mistake why wasn't it disqualifying
what have you experienced in your
personal life or your professional life
that you believe prepares you to make
the decisions that a commander-in-chief
has to make that was a record in the
history of Republican politics
here are other ways that Lauer's
interview with Clinton compared to his
interview with Trump were some of the
emails sent to received by you referring
to our drone program our covert drone
probe that you thought your
communications on that were fairly
routine you mentioned you're in Pakistan
some of the emails you sent received
happened while you were overseas and
director Comey also said that while they
have no proof we assessed that it is
possible that hostile actors gained
access to secretary Clinton's personal
email accounts you recently received two
intelligence briefing yes I did did
anything in that briefing without going
into specifics shock or alarm you yes
what kind of research are you doing now
what kind of homework are you doing what
kind of wings are you reading as you
prepare for the day in two months where
you might be elected the next president
of the United States how much well so
spending a lot a lot and I'm doing a lot
of different things will you be prepared
on day one if you're elected president
the United States to tackle these
complex national security what is it how
do you think these people feel when the
person running to be their
commander-in-chief says her vote to go
to war in Iraq was a mistake look I was
not against the war in Iraq I was
totally against the war in Iraq that the
United States alone could not do right
but you said that wait I think you're
gonna cheat this is an important issue I
know we're in on TV we don't have a lot
of time when I get to a lot of questions
not quickly as briefly as you can
if I win I don't want a broadcast to the
enemy exactly what my plan is and let me
tell you so let me read some of the
things you said I know more about Isis
than the generals do believe me was that
the truth well the generals under Barack
Obama and Hillary Clinton have not been
successful
do you know about Isis than they do I
think under the leadership of Barack
Obama and Hillary Clinton the generals
have been reduced to rubble make it more
difficult for us to have a coalition
with muslim-majority nations and we'd
rather have nine men going to help us
succeed in defeating Isis and protecting
our American homeland Secretary Hillary
Clinton
let me end in kind of the same place I
started have you given much thought mr.
Trump if you're elected president and
commander-in-chief to that moment where
you're going to have to make that first
decision that puts American men and
women in harm's way I think it's the
most difficult decision you can possibly
ever make
